texts: If you are new to the TfL Pension Fund, the following guide for new members provides a brief overview of the Fund and the benefits it offers.
More detailed guides are included below.
This guide is for you if:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["You joined the Fund on 1 April 1989 as a result of the merger of the London Transport Pension Fund and the 1970 Superannuation Fund","You were in service at 1 April 1989, aged over 18, but had not completed a year's service or were too young to join either the London Transport Pension Fund or the 1970 Superannuation Fund and were automatically entered into the Fund on 1 April 1989","You were under 18 on 1 April 1989, and at that date were given the option, which you accepted, to join the Fund on reaching age 18"]}

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"A guide for existing members","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/tflpf-guide-for-members-existing-april-2009.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 1.12MB","image":{}},{"title":"Addendum to a guide for existing members","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/addendum-guide-for-existing-members.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 103KB","image":{}},{"title":"Addendum to member guide","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/addendum-to-member-guide-may-2016.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 39KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

This guide is for you if you joined the TfL Pension Fund after 1 April 1989* or are considering joining.
*Unless you fall under the 3rd bullet point below.

If you need to tell us about changes to your address or bank details, go to the Forms section and download the relevant form.
